title: Death at the Ashcombe Gala
description: Reginald Ashcombe, patriarch and philanthropist, is found dead at the bottom of his grand staircase following his annual charity gala. The constable calls it an accident. But his widow suspects murder. Question suspects, examine evidence, and uncover the truth behind the fall.

suspects.name: Veronica Ashcombe
suspects.bio: 62 years old, graceful and intelligent. Once a concert pianist, now manages the social and charitable side of Ashcombe Estate. Found Reginald's body at the bottom of the grand staircase.

suspects.name: Martin Ashcombe
suspects.bio: 61 years old, Reginald's younger brother. Charming but financially dependent. Former academic who squandered opportunities through gambling. Was very drunk during the gala.
suspects.veronicaNote: Reginald's younger brother. Sixty-one, yet he possesses the impulse control of a schoolboy. He has spent a lifetime in my husband's shadow, and I fear he has grown to resent the lack of light. A gambler in both finance and life.

suspects.name: Colin Dorsey
suspects.bio: 53 years old, Reginald's right hand and estate manager. Competent and loyal on the surface. Responded to Veronica's scream after the body was discovered.
suspects.veronicaNote: The Estate Manager. He was once Reginald's right hand, but that hand has withered. Competent, yes, but there is a desperation in him now. He and my husband quarreled years ago—trust once broken is never truly mended.

suspects.name: Lydia Portwell
suspects.bio: 44 years old, polished and ambitious. Oversees the Ashcombe Foundation's fundraising campaigns. Was helping Veronica rehearse her speech when the murder occurred.
suspects.veronicaNote: Director of the Foundation. She is polished, ambitious, and curates her public image as carefully as she does our charity galas. She claims to serve the family, but I suspect she serves only her own ascent.

suspects.name: Dr. Leonard Vale
suspects.bio: 58 years old, elegant and calculating. Longtime friend of the Ashcombe family and attending physician. Left the ballroom early for an 'urgent phone call' before Reginald's death.
suspects.veronicaNote: The Physician. A "friend" of the family for decades. He is elegant and calculating, with a bedside manner that is almost too calm. He pronounced Reginald dead without a flicker of emotion. I have always found his stillness... unsettling.

locations.name: Greenhouse
locations.description: Reginald's pride and joy - a glass-domed greenhouse filled with rare orchids and tropical blooms. He personally led tours here during the afternoon.

galaAnnotations.vale_greenhouse.png: Dr. Vale taking in Reginald's rare orchids he loved so very much. The conservatory was the one place Leonard truly seemed happy.
galaAnnotations.lydia_greenhouse.jpg: Lydia admiring the orchids during the afternoon tour. She always had a way of making even a greenhouse visit feel like a networking opportunity.
galaAnnotations.reginald_greenhouse.jpg: Reginald in his element, surrounded by his prized collection. The greenhouse was his sanctuary, where he could cultivate beauty without the complications of human nature.
galaAnnotations.greenhouse_colin.jpg: Colin surveying the greenhouse during the afternoon tour, his watchful presence never far from the proceedings.
galaAnnotations.greenhouse_martin.png: Martin among the orchids, appearing remarkably composed for once. The greenhouse tour was early in the day, before the drinking began in earnest.

locations.name: Lawn & Terrace
locations.description: Where the afternoon luncheon was held. White canopies, champagne, and society's polished conversation filled the space earlier that day.

galaAnnotations.veronica_outside.png: I needed a moment away from the heat of the ballroom. Standing there in the dark, watching the party through the glass, I realized how much I've come to prefer the silence over the performance.
galaAnnotations.lawn_gala1.jpg: Leonard and Martin at the afternoon luncheon, an unlikely pair standing together amid the festivities.
galaAnnotations.lawn_gala2.jpg: The afternoon luncheon in full view. Guests mingling between the tables, champagne flowing, everyone dressed in their finest. The estate watched over us like it always did, grand and unchanging.
galaAnnotations.lawn_gala3.png: Always the gracious host, commanding attention even in casual conversation. He wore that smile so easily.
galaAnnotations.lawn_gala4.png: The lawn stretched out before us, every detail arranged to perfection. Reginald always said presentation was everything.
galaAnnotations.lawn_gala5.jpg: A view of the estate from the lawn. The house stood proud above us, holding all its secrets behind those elegant windows.

locations.name: Ballroom
locations.description: The grand ballroom where the evening's charity presentation took place. Crystal chandeliers, live music, and dozens of guests filled the space.

galaAnnotations.itinerary.png: The evening's schedule, carefully planned to the minute. Every detail accounted for—or so we thought.
galaAnnotations.colin_white_gloves.png: A quiet moment near the gallery entrance while the quartet played. Colin was standing watch as he always does, keeping a meticulous eye on the staff and the flow of the room from the shadows.
galaAnnotations.colin_champagne.png: The gala in full swing. Colin was moving through the crowd with his usual precision, ensuring the champagne never ran low despite the heat in the ballroom.
galaAnnotations.lydia_networking.png: A masterclass in networking. Lydia managed the gala floor with effortless grace, never missing a beat or a potential donor. She and I have spent many nights like this, though she always seemed to have more energy for the social dance than I did.
galaAnnotations.lydia_shaking_hands.png: Lydia was welcoming the late arrivals near the dining area, her composure never wavering.
galaAnnotations.martin_mingling.jpg: Martin in his element, holding court by the floral displays. He was the life of the party long after the rest of us grew tired of the pretense. There is a certain effortlessness to his irresponsibility that I've always found both fascinating and exhausting.
galaAnnotations.martin_shaking_hands.png: Martin at the entrance, playing the welcoming host to perfection. He spent the evening greeting every arrival with that practiced academic charm, making sure the guests felt at home while the staff quietly managed the logistics right at his elbow.
galaAnnotations.martin_lounging.png: Untied bowtie and a glass of scotch—living the life of leisure that Reginald's success has always afforded him.
galaAnnotations.reginald_lydia_conversation.jpg: Reginald and Lydia discussing Foundation business late into the evening. Even with the music playing, the air between them felt remarkably heavy.
galaAnnotations.reginald_veronica_dancing.jpg: Our final dance. For those few minutes, we weren't a Foundation or an estate; we were just a husband and wife, performing the role we'd perfected over forty years.
galaAnnotations.vale_gala.png: Leonard has always had a way of looking through people rather than at them. Even with a glass in his hand and music in the air, he seemed to be performing a diagnostic on the entire room. He hardly spoke a word all evening.
galaAnnotations.vale_gala_2.png: Leonard spent most of the night like this—standing in the center of the ballroom but feeling worlds away.
galaAnnotations.veronica_champagne.jpg: Mid-gala. A moment of quiet luxury before the evening took its final, sharp turn. Even then, the emeralds felt heavier than usual.

locations.name: Grand Staircase
locations.description: The crime scene. Reginald's body was found at the bottom of these marble stairs. A wine glass lay nearby, its dark contents spilled across the floor in a tight cluster.

galaAnnotations.reginald_wine_spill.png: The wine pooled there like a dark shadow, marking the place where I found him. I cannot bear to look at this for long—the memory of seeing him there, so still, will haunt me forever.

locations.name: Master Bedroom (Private Wing)
locations.description: Veronica and Reginald's private quarters. Elegant and intimate, with a grand painting that Reginald's mother Elizabeth had painted hanging on the wall and a piano bench where Veronica keeps sheet music.

locations.name: Reginald's Study
locations.description: Reginald's private office. A place of business and secrets. The study contains a safe where Reginald kept his most sensitive documents.

records.name: Coroner's Report
records.description: Official autopsy and scene analysis. Rules the death as accidental.
records.content:
CAUSE OF DEATH: Fatal skull fracture

FINDINGS: Injury pattern consistent with fall from TOP of staircase. Single point of impact. No secondary bruising or defensive wounds.

TOXICOLOGY: Alcohol present, within social drinking range.

RULING: Accidental fall. No evidence of foul play.

records.name: Veronica's Thank-You Note
records.description: A private message from Veronica, grateful for confirming her suspicions. She explains why she hid the blackmail papers and supplies them for investigation.

records.name: Dr. Vale's Medical Notes
records.description: Handwritten medical log entries from Dr. Vale documenting his care of Reginald and Veronica Ashcombe. Contains routine check-ups and a notable wine allergy incident.

records.name: Blackmail Papers - Found Near Body
records.description: Documents found scattered near Reginald's body, collected by Veronica. Contains incriminating evidence on Martin, Lydia, and Colin - but Dr. Vale's page is missing.

records.name: Blackmail Papers - Found Behind Painting
records.description: The complete set of blackmail documents hidden behind a painting that Reginald's mother Elizabeth had painted, which hangs in the master bedroom. Contains incriminating evidence on Martin, Colin, Lydia, and Dr. Vale that Reginald had collected.

records.name: Martin's Blackmail - Found Near Body
records.description: Martin Ashcombe's blackmail documents found scattered near Reginald's body. Contains evidence of Martin's affair with Clara and subsequent hush money payments.

records.name: Lydia's Blackmail - Found Near Body
records.description: Lydia Portwell's blackmail documents found scattered near Reginald's body. Contains evidence of embezzlement from the Ashcombe Foundation.

records.name: Colin's Blackmail - Found Near Body
records.description: Colin Dorsey's blackmail documents found scattered near Reginald's body. Contains evidence of Colin's attempt to sell Dorothy Ashcombe's ring on the black market.

records.name: Martin's Blackmail - Behind Painting
records.description: Martin Ashcombe's complete blackmail documents hidden behind the painting in the master bedroom. Contains the full evidence of his affair with Clara.

records.name: Lydia's Blackmail - Behind Painting
records.description: Lydia Portwell's complete blackmail documents hidden behind the painting in the master bedroom. Contains detailed evidence of her embezzlement scheme.

records.name: Colin's Blackmail - Behind Painting
records.description: Colin Dorsey's complete blackmail documents hidden behind the painting in the master bedroom. The real evidence showing Colin attempted to sell Dorothy Ashcombe's ring - the most prized family heirloom.

records.name: Dr. Vale's Blackmail - Behind Painting
records.description: Dr. Leonard Vale's blackmail documents hidden behind the painting in the master bedroom. Contains evidence of his prescription fraud and financial troubles.

records.name: Phone Records
records.description: Estate phone logs from the evening of the gala, showing all incoming and outgoing calls.

records.name: Reginald's Speech Notes
records.description: Handwritten notes for Reginald's opening remarks at the gala. Contains his planned speech with personal annotations.

records.name: Greenhouse Security Footage
records.description: Automatically uploaded security camera footage from the greenhouse, timestamped during the gala.

records.name: Security Camera Footage
records.description: 18 clips from the estate's security camera system showing various locations during the gala night. The footage was accessed from the monitor in Reginald's study.
